result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick C Marion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent to counts two-four.
Probation conditions apply to all counts.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Upoon successful completion of probation,  Court will allow for expungement of Count one only.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay wil result in a civil judgment:  all court coss, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  
If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

records.addlTxt: /Denying Request for Expungement, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carolina Stark, Branch 17, calendar successor, for review. mag
Letter from defendant asking for an expungement.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILED. OS
NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILED. OS
Count one only.

Defendant Patrick C Marion in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Katie Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but concurrent to Counts 2-4; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation. 

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but concurrent to Count 1, 3 & 4.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but concurrent to Count 1, 2 & 4.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but concurrent to Count 1, 2 & 3.

Court STAYED the sentence in Counts 2, 3 & 4 and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Upon successful completion of probation Court will allow for expungement of Count 1 only. 

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Patrick C Marion in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Counts 1-4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Patrick C Marion in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a plea hearing, however, court is unable to hear this case today.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 22. Court instructs the defendant to continue to follow all the rules of his release.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

css

Defendant Patrick C Marion in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Zachary Wittchow for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/26/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Patrick C Marion in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Patrick C Marion in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
